newsitem.title: USA: Elvis honored with postal tribute by Pacific nation.
newsitem.headline: Elvis honored with postal tribute by Pacific nation.

text.p: The tiny Pacific nation of Micronesia is issuing a set of postage stamps to mark Elvis Presley's death 20 years ago, the issue's organizer said on Thursday.

The six stamps trace Presley's life from high school through the movie years, delicately overlooking his subsequent deterioration. Presley died in his Graceland residence in Memphis, Tennessee, on Aug. 16, 1977, at the age of 42.

The stamps will be unveiled on Friday at the Elvis-themed California State Fair in Sacramento by state governor Pete Wilson and the Federated States of Micronesia's ambassador to the United Nations, Resio Moses.

The issue was organized by New York-based Inter-Governmental Philatelic Corp., which contracts with various nations to issue stamps featuring celebrities ranging from Sylvester Stallone to Jackie Kennedy Onassis.
The stamps are legal tender in their country of origin, but are mainly aimed at international collectors.
